pullRequest.body:
Any function on a finite type is multipliable / summable; a function on a discrete measurable space is integrable iff its norm is summable.

---

Could you provide this lemma (and the ones below) for `Measure.average` as well?

Actually it looks like I was misunderstanding in our zulip discussion: `MeasureTheory.average` is not a measure in its own right, but an operator on functions defined as `(Î¼ univ).toRealâ»Â¹ â€¢ âˆ« x, f x âˆ‚Î¼`. So I think there isn't an analogue.

I think
```suggestion
lemma Multipliable.of_finite [Finite Î²] {f : Î² â†’ Î±} : Multipliable f :=
```
is more useful in that it lets you write `some_theorem .of_finite` to get rid of the side condition.

This is also justified by the fact that `f` will always be inferrable by unification in practice
I don't think the "I" does make a difference here.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (MeasureTheory/Function): trivial cases of integrability / summability
